DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Case Report Form Use Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason for completion of the concomitant medication case report form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Domain Concomitant Agent Case Report Form Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration._A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol._A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each clinical trial subject._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Property.preferredName: Concomitant Agent Case Report Form Use
Property.preferredDefinition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.:A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each clinical trial subject.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol's complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol.
A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each clinical trial subject.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pharmaceutical agent other than agent(s) tested in a given protocol that is administered to or used by a subject either prior to or during the study. Supportive care and essential ancillary medications required by a treatment regimen should be clearly identified. A protocol complete instructions including appropriate indication, dosage, administration route, schedule, restrictions to use, and any other relevant data should be explicitly stated. Concept also refers to substance(s) used prior or during the study that are not specified by the protocol._A printed or electronic document with spaces to be filled out._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: Increasing by successive addition.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Specified; clearly and explicitly stated.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.: An event or sequence of events that constitute round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used to refer to every member of a group of people or things, considered individually.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.: The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: Used to refer to every member of a group of people or things, considered individually.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
